Questions.QuestionString: Power supplies to EEC:
Answers: From the Permanent magnet alternator (PMA) only
From the aircraft or from the Permanent magnet alternator (PMA) as a backup supply
From the Permanent magnet alternator (PMA) or from the aircraft as a backup supply

Questions.QuestionString: What is Integrated fuel pump and control (IFPC) for?
Answers: IFPC supplies metered fuel flow to the engine as scheduled by the EEC
IFPC supplies pressurized fuel to engine component actuators

Questions.QuestionString: How is Return to tank (RTT) valve controlled?
Answers: The RTT valve is controlled by EEC (12)
The RTT valve is controlled by EEC, and is actuated based on aircraft altitude, ambient temperature and fuel flow
The RTT valve is controlled by FQIC and EEC, and is actuated based on aircraft altitude, ambient temperature and fuel flow

Questions.QuestionString: The fuel metering valve located in IFPC and controlled by:
To minimize the build-up of carbon in the combustion chamber and to reduces toxic gas emissions at engine shutdown:
Answers: Remaining fuel from the primary and secondary lines is collected and discharged overboard through drain mast
Remaining fuel from the primary and secondary lines is purged into combustion chamber
Remaining fuel from the primary and secondary lines is drained and collected in recovery tank and reused at next startup

Questions.QuestionString: How is the Return-to-Tank (RTT) valve controlled?
Answers: By the EEC and is actuated based on aircraft altitude, ambient temperature, and fuel flow
By the PHMU and is actuated based on fuel temperature
By the EIU and is actuated based on fuel temperature

Questions.QuestionString: How do the EEC’s both channels operate at normal mode?
Identify the number of fuel nozzles?
The ring of vanes of Turbine Nozzle Assembly makes?
Answers: Changing the direction of the hot gases to provide optimal flow, and pressure to the 1st stage turbine blades
Changing the direction of the hot gases to provide optimal angle, and flow to the combustion chamber
Changing the direction of the hot gases to provide optimal angle, pressure, and flow to the 1st stage turbine blades

Questions.QuestionString: Where is P2.5/T2.5 probe locate?
PMA (Permanent Magnet Alternator) is cooled by:
The PHMU (Prognostics and Health Management Unit) communicates with EEC via:
The engine inlet pressure (P2) is measured by:
Answers: P2/T2 probe located at 1 o’clock on inlet cowl
It is not measured directly, instead the EEC calculates P2 from Ps14

Questions.QuestionString: What is the function of the PHMU (Prognostics and Health Management Unit)?
Answers: To monitor engine oil debris and FDGS lubrication. Also to calculates engine vibration and fan trim balance solutions
To predict the engine future malfunctions

Questions.QuestionString: The Pressure Fuel consist of:
Answers: Fuel cooling, fuel metered and fuel muscle
Fuel cooling, fuel return and fuel cycle
Fuel return, fuel cycle and fuel muscle

Questions.QuestionString: Is fuel flow used to cool down IDG oil and engine oil through?
The collected fuel remains in ecology collector tank is drawn back into fuel system when?
The FADEC consists of?
Answers: EEC, PHMU, sensors and output drivers

Questions.QuestionString: The PW110G Engine rating adjusted by:
The EEC and PHMU attached to Engine Fan Case
The fan speed (Nf) speed sensors send signals direct to
How many fuel nozzles are there on PW 1130 Engine?
When the fuel filter becomes blocked by contamination:
Answers: “Fuel filter degraded” message generated on ECAM
“Fuel filter clogged” message generated on ECAM
“Fuel filter degraded” or “Fuel filter clogged” message generated on ECAM depending on specific differential pressure values

Questions.QuestionString: What is the function of the PHMU (Prognostics and Health Management Unit)?
Answers: To monitor engine oil debris and FDGS lubrication, also to calculate engine vibration and fan trim balance solutions
To predict the engine future malfunctions

Questions.QuestionString: When an output control failure is detected in active channel EEC:
Answers: The EEC switches to passive/active operation mode
The EEC switches to active/active operation mode
The EEC switches to standby/active operation mode

Questions.QuestionString: What data is stored in DSU (Data Storage Unit)?
Answers: The Permanent Magnet Alternator (PMA) when N2 > 12%

Questions.QuestionString: Normally the EEC is powered from:
Answers: engine configuration and identification, usage and exceedance historical data, thrust ratings and vibration monitoring.
engine configuration, identification and vibration monitoring.
The aircraft as a primary supply

Questions.QuestionString: Which component divides the fuel to primary and secondary manifold?
Data Storage Unit connects to:
What are/is the kind of different pressure fuel filter clog indication(s) available?
The annular combustion chamber houses
